mapper.update:
update tc_category
cate_name = #{cateName,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
pid = #{pid,jdbcType=CHAR},
pids = #{pids,jdbcType=CHAR},
cate_level = #{cateLevel,jdbcType=INTEGER},
sort = #{sort,jdbcType=INTEGER},
remark = #{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
state = #{state,jdbcType=CHAR},
create_by = #{createBy,jdbcType=CHAR},
create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
update_by = #{updateBy,jdbcType=CHAR},
update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=CHAR}

update tc_category set cate_name = #{cateName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, pid = #{pid,jdbcType=CHAR}, pids = #{pids,jdbcType=CHAR}, cate_level = #{cateLevel,jdbcType=INTEGER}, sort = #{sort,jdbcType=INTEGER}, remark = #{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, state = #{state,jdbcType=CHAR}, create_by = #{createBy,jdbcType=CHAR}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, update_by = #{updateBy,jdbcType=CHAR}, update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where id = #{id,jdbcType=CHAR}
mapper.select:
select
from tc_category where state = '1' order by cate_level, sort

select
from tc_category where state = '1' and cate_level='1' order by cate_level, sort

SELECT
FROM tc_category WHERE state = '1' AND pid = #{pid}
AND cate_name LIKE "%"#{cateName}"%"
ORDER BY sort
